intro: Reseda valentina subsp. valentina, commonly known as sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or violet, bloom in late spring to early summer. Reseda valentina subsp. valentina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
